columns.booking_id: The unique identifier for each booking made.
columns.product_id: The unique identifier for each product booked.
columns.returned_yn: The status indicating if the product was returned.
columns.returned_late_yn: The status indicating if the product was returned late.
columns.booked_count: The total number of items booked for the product.
columns.booked_amount: The total monetary amount for the booking.

Products_Booked.table_description: The table tracks bookings of products along with their return status.

columns.product_id: The unique identifier for each product in the system.
columns.booking_id: The unique identifier for each booking made for the product.
columns.status_date: The date and time when the product availability is recorded.
columns.available_yn: The status indicating if the product is available for booking.

View_Product_Availability.table_description: The table provides real-time product availability based on bookings.

columns.coupon_id: The unique identifier for each discount coupon issued.
columns.date_issued: The date and time when the coupon was issued.
columns.coupon_amount: The monetary value of the discount provided by the coupon.

Discount_Coupons.table_description: The table tracks discount coupons issued to customers.

columns.customer_id: The unique identifier for each customer in the system.
columns.coupon_id: The identifier for the discount coupon associated with the customer.
columns.good_or_bad_customer: The status indicating if the customer is good or bad.
columns.first_name: The given name of the customer.
columns.last_name: The family name of the customer.
columns.gender_mf: The gender of the customer, represented by a single character.
columns.date_became_customer: The date and time when the customer joined.
columns.date_last_hire: The date and time of the customer's last hire.

Customers.table_description: The table stores details about customers and their hiring history.

columns.booking_id: The unique identifier for each booking made.
columns.customer_id: The unique identifier for the customer making the booking.
columns.booking_status_code: The status of the booking (e.g., Confirmed, Provisional).
columns.returned_damaged_yn: The status indicating if the product was returned damaged.
columns.booking_start_date: The date and time when the booking starts.
columns.booking_end_date: The date and time when the booking ends.
columns.count_hired: The total number of items hired under this booking.
columns.amount_payable: The total amount to be paid for the booking.
columns.amount_of_discount: The total monetary discount applied to the booking.
columns.amount_outstanding: The amount still outstanding to be paid for the booking.
columns.amount_of_refund: The total amount refunded related to the booking.

Bookings.table_description: The table tracks bookings along with their status and payment details.

columns.product_id: The unique identifier for each product available for hire.
columns.product_type_code: The categorization of the product type being hired.
columns.daily_hire_cost: The cost charged per day for product hire.
columns.product_name: The name of the product available for hire.
columns.product_description: The detailed description of the product being hired.

Products_for_Hire.table_description: The table lists products available for hire with their details and costs.

columns.payment_id: The unique identifier for each payment made.
columns.booking_id: The unique identifier for the booking associated with the payment.
columns.customer_id: The unique identifier for the customer making the payment.
columns.payment_type_code: The method of payment used for the transaction.
columns.amount_paid_in_full_yn: The status indicating if the payment was made in full.
columns.payment_date: The date and time when the payment was processed.
columns.amount_due: The total amount due for the payment.
columns.amount_paid: The total amount that has been paid.

Payments.table_description: The table records payment transactions related to bookings.
